cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 55 mi ENE of Guantanamo, Cuba and 20 mi NW of the eastern tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving north, forecast to turn NNW then NW and parallel/brush the Florida east coast before continuing up the Southeast U.S. coastline
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just offshore the east-central Florida coast (North Palm Beach–Sebastian Inlet area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch north of Sebastian Inlet to the Flagler/Volusia County line on Florida’s east coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from Golden Beach to Sebastian Inlet including Lake Okeechobee; Tropical-Storm Warning Chokoloskee to Golden Beach and Florida Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Bahamas and the entire Florida east coast northward to the Georgia/South Carolina border over the next 3-4 days
weather_observation.wind: Elevated winds possible Thursday night–Friday; brief tropical-storm-force gusts (30–40 mph) cannot be ruled out.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the west-central Florida coast because Matthew stays east of the peninsula.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible as outer rainbands sweep across central Florida late Thursday into Friday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Choppy seas and hazardous small-craft conditions on Tampa Bay and approaches.
